Package ca.camosun.ics124.lab6

Class BinarySearchTree<E extends Comparable<? super E>>

Type Parameters:
E - data stored in this collection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<E>
public abstract class BinarySearchTree<E extends Comparable<? super E>> implements Iterable<E>
A sorted collection backed by a binary tree. Stored values must implement the Comparable interface, and will be sorted according to their natural order. null data values are not supported. Duplicate values may be added, and the collection will preserve their order (later added items last).

  • Field Details

    • root

      protected BinarySearchTree<E extends Comparable<? super E>>.Node root
      Base of the storage tree. This will be null if the tree is empty.

  • Method Details

    • has

      public boolean has(E value)
      Check whether or not this collection contains the given value. Equivalent values are determined according to Comparable.compareTo(T).
      Parameters:
      value - the value to search for
      Returns:
      true if the given value is present; false otherwise

    • add

      public abstract boolean add(E value) throws NullPointerException
      Add a value to the collection. Duplicates are allowed and will be preserved in order of addition (oldest first).
      Parameters:
      value - the data value to add
      Returns:
      true if the added value is unique within the collection; false if a duplicate value is already present
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if a null value is provided

    • remove

      public abstract boolean remove(E value)
      Remove a value from the collection. Returns false when called with a null parameter, since null values cannot be stored in this collection.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to remove
      Returns:
      true if the collection was modified; false if the given value was not in the collection

    • iterator

      public abstract Iterator<E> iterator()
      Create an iterator over all stored values, in natural order. Duplicate values will be provided in the order that they were added to the collection. This is a fail-fast iterator; that is, changes to the collection after the iterator is constructed will cause the iterator to throw ConcurrentModificationException on any subsequent action.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<E extends Comparable<? super E>>
      Returns:
      an inorder iterator

    • max

      public abstract E max() throws NoSuchElementException
      Get the largest value in the collection. If the collection contains duplicate maximum values, there are no guarantees about which specific duplicate is returned.
      Returns:
      the maximum value
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the collection is empty

    • min

      public abstract E min()
      Get the smallest value in the collection. If the collection contains duplicate minimum values, there are no guarantees about which specific duplicate is returned.
      Returns:
      the minimum value
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the collection is empty

    • size

      public abstract int size()
      Count the number of values contained within this collection, including duplicates.
      Returns:
      number of stored values
